replies.body:
I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but apparently it's not as easy as just turning them into real skins for free :(

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6zwvv1/were_the_rioters_from_the_star_guardian_team_ask/dmypc7p/

From RiotVitzkrieg, the art lead on Star Guardians:

> Glad you like the alien versions of the monsters we made for the mode! I'm sorry to say there aren't any plans right now to release those versions as skins though. They were built specifically for the mode, and don't meet the criteria for full champion skins.
That being said, all the tech we used for their visuals is reusable and will hopefully lead to cooler skins in the future!

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=7N1XtIAH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-09-14T15:30:35.082+0000)

> 
> From RiotVitzkrieg, the art lead on Star Guardians:
> That being said, all the tech we used for their visuals is reusable and will hopefully lead to cooler skins in the future!

My issue is I've heard they don't meet the criteria; they weren't fully synced up to a full champion's kit/skills. They've been requested. I know the skin-base for monstrous champion users DO like the options. Personally, I'm sure it'll be forever before anything is done with Skarner again. So another option would have been really nice. 

Is the baseline for them not meeting the criteria for skins more that they come across as chromas? Or is it that it's not deemed profitable to give them some colored particle effects to hit 750 tier? I'd like to actually here some more context on the adversity to meeting the desire versus...

"I'm delivering unto you this news with regrets because of [insert quote here]."

Heyo, sorry for the confusion! Let me help clarify where we're at with those custom SG monsters.

As I mentioned before, we didn't build these to be champion skins. What that means is that aside from some tech limitations (they're actually new characters instead of skins, and use some new tech that hasn't been back ported to the original champions), we didn't even consider how they'd fit the champs as playable characters. That means we didn't do our due diligence we'd normally do for any new skin (concepting any abilities other than the ones you saw, checking skin readability on SR, cleaning up VFX clarity/performance, etc etc).

All that means is we can't just sell you guys what we have in existence right now. There's been a very loud and clear request to be able to play as these badass monsters, and we hear you! I want to make it clear that I'm not promising anything, but I've started conversations with our skins team about what it'd take to turn these into real skins. We'll see where it goes from here :)
Why not just sell them for 750?

It was just explained why they can't just be shipped as skins.....

>That means we didn't do our due diligence we'd normally do for any new skin (concepting any abilities other than the ones you saw, checking skin readability on SR, cleaning up VFX clarity/performance, etc etc)

This means while they work great for the Star Guardian map, the skins were not made to work on other maps yet. 
So I can see these becoming skins eventually, just not yet because of how different these are when you actually compare them to the originals.

Because, as he just explained, they literally aren't even skins. They're entirely new characters, and aren't able to be "attached" to the actual champions (they don't have any way to hook them up to the originals' animations, abilities, VO, etc).
It's not about how the skins look, it's how the interact with the gameplay as a player model.

I think the simple yet very cool style is what every one wants in their skins here.

Green/purple glow is quite awesome

Thank you for the clarification. Explaining the specific details always helps me feel better with Riot's decisions (even if I don't always agree). I appreciate the perspective.

I understand that it isn't a promise. But I feel better knowing that giving the loud and clear feedback that we appreciate the team's works might bear fruit to a more permanent skin set makes me happy. Thank you for starting the conversation. How will we know how the conversation is going? Will there be an update like a Riot Pls post explaining the final verdict, or...? Obviously, I know there are way more hurdles when actually testing there. I'm just wondering if we might say know something before a few months down the line.

{{sticker:sg-janna}}

Nightmare skinline? Just a thought since Cho already has a purple skin. It would mean Cho would have to wait until his VGU to really match the rest of them, but I think "Nightmare" is a really good description for the skinline.

Considering the overwhelming feedback on people wanting these skins I'm surprised the skins team aren't already all over this shit. 

Personally, I'm just gagging for a new badass Vel'Koz skin because I dislike Battlecast and the April Fools skin, and seeing the model in game made me so excited for it to possibly be a skin in the near future. I was extremely disappointed when I realised it was no more than an in-game model and ended up sucking some hype out of the event.
I'm disappointed in the skins team for not jumping on this opportunity ASAP because all of the champions (excluding Kha'Zix and Kog) are in need of some skin love and the skins are guaranteed to sell well as people will want to buy them to fit in with the Star Guardian thematic (appealing most to those who aren't interested in glittery girly styles). 

Please, if anyone from the skins team sees this, definitely consider investing some time into this theme! We know you guys are able to do it considering the fire skins you guys keep coming up with, there's no excuse! {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

I;d be lying if I said I wasn't extremely dissapointed... as much as I know how popular the SG skin line is and how different the event was I cant stand the magical Girl theme and while invasion was cool I dont ever have 5 people to just play with so this entire event was just impossible for me, It took me almost a week to finish the first mission even with the SG event guide and the second solo mission I've just flat out Given up on, Not to mention the rewards were painfully disappointing... A champion permanent or a ward skin? Dont get me wrong I'm sure for players who dont have every champ that mighta been nice and a ward skins pretty and all but I'm never gonna use anything but my fist bump ward so I had no interest in it,  I wish you guys had decided early in to possibly make those as other rewards for the event then I might force myself to play it more but its just way too hard for nearly no reward :/ Now hearing they may not ever happen as skins when they would all be for 4 of my Fave champs in league even tho it looks so cool. Hella disheartening tbh {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

Wouldn't the most reasonable course of action be to sell them as 390 RP skins like Assassin Yi? You heard the people, they'd welcome any fresh content at this point (especially the Rek'Sai and Vel'Koz players).

Just update Nightmare Cho'Gath to this look and call the skin line "Nightmare" 

{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

Given how people have been asking for these, I don't see why there's a reason for Riot not to do this. They already have all the assets, so all they need to do is put them on the skins store and make money.

I would definitely buy that Kog'Maw one.
